title: Rust ignores extern ABI used for called function if is different than the caller's (/efiapi?)
body:
I tried the following code inside an extern "efiapi" function:

```rust
info!("{:#X?}", explosion as *const _);

unsafe {
    asm!("cli");

    let entry: fn (&'static kaboom::ExplosionResult) -> ! = core::mem::transmute(elf.header.pt2.entry_point());

    entry(Box::leak(explosion));
}
```

The entry point's signature is:
```rust
#[no_mangle]
pub fn kernel_main(explosion: &'static kaboom::ExplosionResult) -> ! {
    // Writing explosion's ptr to serial here
}
```

I expected to see the following serial output:
```
[ INFO]:  src/main.rs@245: 0x0000000006538018
Fuse ignition begun.
Boot loader data ptr: 0x6538018
Fuse initialization complete.
```

Instead, got the following serial output:
```
[ INFO]:  src/main.rs@245: 0x0000000006538018
Fuse ignition begun.
Boot loader data ptr: 0x6537918
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (fdf65053e 2021-09-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: fdf65053e99e8966f9bd83b5a8491326cb33d638
commit-date: 2021-09-07
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

See discussion on question I made in the Rust user forum: https://users.rust-lang.org/t/data-in-static-kernel-entry-point-argument-seems-corrupted/64465

### Temporary workarounds
Have to call the function manually using inline assembly, or change the function signature to use the caller's ABI.
